headline: Awesome Culture! Opportunity for growth
pros: I absolutely love my time working for Venterra so far. I have been a leasing consultant here for about 6 months and my entire time here has blown me away. I was shocked by how much the company genuinely seems to care about the employees and set them up for success. The culture is set up to favor team work, cooperation, and genuine care. I have been with companies before that say that they value their employees and they value genuine care, but the way they show it is empty. This is not the case with Venterra. From what I have seen so far, they prove day in and day out that they actually place importance on their values. I haven't met a coworker or manager yet that hasn't been a pleasure to work with or for, and this is thanks to everyone being set up with the tools they need to be successful and to foster team work and comradery. There is also a lot of room for growth, Venterra always tries their best to hire from within and provide opportunities for current employees. Also, Venterra pays a portion of college tuition if you are a student, and has initiatives set up to assist anyone that is interested in learning and growth.
cons: It honestly is hard to think of cons. Of course, nowhere you work will be completely perfect, but Venterra is pretty darn close. I guess one con is that it doesn't always feel like there is enough staff for coverage if there is an unexpected outage. I always feel like I can take scheduled time off if I need to, but if I ever have an emergency on a day where someone else is off it leaves the office understaffed.

Those come first and the system comes off as pushy, aggressive and bothersome. Venterra tries to Murrow Chick Fil A‚Äôs purpose and mission and that is a fail unfortunately. headline: It's like white-water rafting. The question is, do you like white-water rafting?
pros:
When I started with Venterra, what caught my attention was that they were a young startup with tons of growth potential. The first interview I had was by phone with an executive in Canada. My second, another phone interview with a different executive in Canada. By the end of the second call, my curiosity was piqued, as both interviewers were very passionate about the company they were building. At the time, I was in Austin, but to meet with a third person, I needed to drive to a property they had just acquired in Arlington, TX. 

I circled that property three times before deciding that driving off was not an option! Let‚Äôs just say the curb appeal wasn‚Äôt the best. But I committed to the interview, someone was waiting inside, and I needed to at least see it through, but my head was already back in Austin. Or so I thought. Once again, I was met with passion, and real talk about real problems that Venterra wanted to solve. Venterra's values were impressed on me now for a third time: Honesty and Integrity, Humility, Never-ending Pursuit of Excellence, Candor and Openness, Team First, Unparalleled Service Excellence, and Prudent Cost Management. Now, every company has corporate values, but trust me, few truly live and run their company by them. I knew this first-hand, and Venterra's values aligned with my own. Specifically, I prefer to be honest and candid with people,over playing politics, and I pursue the best in everything I do; both traits which I‚Äôve been known to sometimes exhibit to a fault. 

In the end (of the beginning), what got me to say yes (when I was a hard "no") was the people and their passion for what they were building. I wanted in and was hungry to make an impact, but I had no intention of being here still, 17 years later. 

As I reflect on my tenure, I am very much aware of why I have stayed and continue to believe in Venterra: Synergy. Aligned values. Excellent leadership. And the autonomy, tools, and trust to try to make the world a better place every day. It‚Äôs more like a long-term, solid friendship than a job. We discuss problems that need to be solved, we get real, we have fun together. We understand that while there will always be challenging times, we are in it together, for the long haul. We are in it to support one another and ensure that everyone is living up to our highest potential. 

I am grateful to have spent the last 17 years with Venterra. I have been exposed to and learned so much from great and smart people, and I am so grateful for the growth, both internally and externally, that we‚Äôve all experienced.
cons: Working for Venterra isn't for everyone, though. It has the heart of a start-up and the mind of the tenured 20-year company that it is. I often say my job is a lot like white-water rafting but in the nude. It's fun and exciting, scary as hell, stressful, and leaves me feeling vulnerable sometimes, but, we get through it, together. If you aren't afraid of hard work, are looking to make an impact, if you‚Äôre looking for the real deal, if you're looking for opportunities, and most importantly - this one is a must - if you share our values, come on board!

headline: My 4 Year Mark
pros: I have worked for many management companies and private owners over my 10 years in maintenance. This has been the only management company that has treated me with the respect and care that I deserve. They value my opinion. They allow you to make mistakes and grow from them. Every staff member and corporate personnel is down to earth and knowledgeable in their field. I can't say that about too many others. Where people lack in experience, they make up for it by asking questions. It has been great working for Venterra.
cons:
This is regionally specific, but it can be hard to move up once you hit certain positions. It isn't so much that they are only looking for people from the outside to lead, but the opportunities for advancement hit a wall if the company hasn't focused as much in acquiring other properties in the region. Sometimes it's the market; sometimes it's a lack of future venture in the region.

If you are a Mentor, you go to different properties to train new people and help them become "Venterrized". There aren't many people in each region to do this job, so we may use Microsoft Teams to train them. Teams, while useful in some settings, is not well suited for maintenance personnel training. It also doesn't come with a raise. If the Mentor and Mentee both fill out a survey, the mentor gets a small bonus. But, for a multitude of reasons, the Mentee does not fill out a survey and the Mentor does not receive the bonus. It may be wise to include a raise ($.25, $.50 etc.) for those people that want to go above and beyond the job they originally were hired to do. It isn't much of a con to me, but it does get annoying.

headline: Culture, Stability, Proffesionalist

They tend to keep their assets for the long term and do not have quick turn around sales after acquiring properties. Whenever they sell a property they are selling an asset that is 1000x better than when they purchased it. 
Should your property ever be put up for sale you truly do not fear the unknown. They are honest and transparent through these processes and make you feel safe through them. There will always be a place for you at Venterra if you are dedicated and you can rest assured that there is a role for everyone. 
We have plenty of employees that have been at one property during a sale and within a short amount of time they are back with us at a different asset!

If you are looking for a great company that does not see you as just a number and cares about your work, life and family balance look no further than Venterra!

headline: The worst decision I‚Äôve ever made
pros: Sometimes they paid for food
cons:
This is a company that has no idea of the direction they intend to go. This company wants to run in 20 different directions all at once. Not a great place for someone who is a thinker and tends to have innovative and creative ideas. Ideas were constantly shut down by management. You would think they would embrace new ideas given that their whole ppc catalogue was severely flawed. For example, most of the portfolio had keywords and ads that said houses for sale when they ONLY rent out apartments. 
This is not a place you would want to work if you prefer to have some kind of structure. The department is disorganized and chaotic. They do not have a centralized location to manage tasks and communication. Instead they have a ton of excel spreadsheets, Voxer (which wasn‚Äôt bad), they have like 40 or more teams channels (when I asked my manager which ones I need to keep up with I was told all of them), they use trello (something I suggested to centralize tasks and communication. I did not expect for it to just be one more thing to keep up with), they used Dropbox, of course they used emails, phone conversations and more. Due to this chaotic system it was easy for management to say they assigned work that was never actually assigned. They can easily say it was discussed on a phone conversation that never took place. It covers them but throws the employee under the bus. 
There‚Äôs been times I would need to do my work 2 or 3 times because everyone had edit access to excel and someone would erase my work. This job offers NO training. They expect you to just come in and easily adapt to their disorganized chaos. 
Let‚Äôs also talk about meetings! It is not uncommon for the director to announce a mandatory meeting at 4pm to be held at 5pm the same day and last up to 2-3 hours. In a lot of those meetings I had no idea what was even being discussed (hence the lack of any training). When I said I don‚Äôt know about any of this stuff, the response would be you‚Äôll get it eventually. Eventually never came. 
This company is the definition of micromanagement. It got to a point where I decided to show them how ridiculous they were being by providing them with a progress report daily. I thought they would have looked at it and realized that I was working hard and that they were being unreasonable in constantly checking on me. I was wrong. Instead it just became a requirement that I provide this report daily. 
The sheer volume of work is ridiculous. I held a job that could have easily been split into 3-4 jobs. I was a ppc specialist, a seo specialist, social media specialist, data analyst, a strategist (all though none of my suggestions were ever appreciated), etc... This may not seem like a lot until you consider that they have over 60 locations and counting. To break this down, their PPC portfolio alone would contain about 50-60 campaigns. Each campaign had at least 3 ads per ad group. Some campaigns had more than one ad group. At any given moment they can say we want to run a new promo and need to change all the ads. That‚Äôs 150 - 200 ads that need to be changed right away. Updating that many ads by yourself can easily take a whole work day or 2. Sure they will say they will help. The times that help was offered, they bailed after doing just a few campaigns due to having other work to do. There was a time that I ended up working late to change the ads and even got up at 4am to complete the remaining ads. This extra work and dedication was overlooked and not appreciated at all. 
I worked hard and at one point I was told regularly how good of a job I was doing. I was told ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what we would do with our you‚Äù. Of course all of that was just empty words because not even a month later I was fired and I was told how horrible of an employee I was. I was fired in the middle of a pandemic with a 7 month pregnant wife who was on my insurance along with my kids. I was thrown away like garbage and all the work I did for them didn‚Äôt matter anymore. They made it clear that I was nothing to them. No job should make their employees feel that way.

pros: Venterra has so many perks! Birthday off, Family Days (allow for more time off with family on the Holidays), referral rewards, so many growth opportunities and resources to expand professional growth. cons: A little over five years with Venterra and I think they have came along way in this small amount of time. They are constantly striving to make the employee and customer experience better.

headline: Simply the best!
pros: Open to a better way of doing things. Room for advancement if you are a consistent performer, Quarterly review process so information is relevant and of assistance. Candid feedback both welcomed and appreciated. Transparent leadership at every level. Amazing culture! We make time to have fun and celebrate both our residents and our employees.
cons:
We are not a 9 to 5 company. That can be perceived as a down side if you are a clock watcher or a nickel and dime type person. 

Have a limited set of vendors we utilize which can lead to slower turnaround.

headline: Great Company That Respects Their Employees
pros: Maintenance manager is in control. "In touch" upper management.
cons: Need longer leave time for bereavement.

headline: Love this company!
pros: I have worked for several companies within this industry, and I can honestly say that Venterra is hands down the best. They keep you informed, which is rare, and the opportunities to advance are there. I also agree with the other reviews... you will not thrive unless you are willing to give it everything you've got. What this means though, it in most cases, you are working alongside others who are willing to go the extra mile with you. The added perks that Venterra offers more than make up for the extra work. I was able to take my family on vacation to Disney for the 1st time, all because of Venterra's generosity.
cons: Honestly, there just aren't many. Pay could always be more, but the added bonuses and perks certainly help.

headline: 9 yrs strong!
pros: I have worked with Venterra for 9 years and I truly love everything about the company.  I feel that I have hit the job jackpot and winning in life! My hard work is always noticed, which motivates me to always give my best.
cons: I would like to see a more competitive health care plan.

headline: Great Place to Work
pros: Venterra strives to promote a culture that is fun, engaging, and makes you want to come to work. Everyone is really great at cheering each other on and supporting each other in times of need. Just seeing what Venterra did for its Houston employees impacted by Hurricane Harvey was moving. They raised $47,000 to give back to employees in need. I don't know of many companies that would make the effort to do this.
cons: While Venterra thrives on its culture and has many great benefits in place, I feel that salaries are still below market value.

headline: World Class Company
pros: Venterra makes it a FUN place to work.  We are always having a contest of some sort and I feel that it keeps it fun.  Venterra also trains you to succeed and gives you the tools you need to do your job.  We also promote from within and I feel that is something people look for.
cons: A downside in our area is that we as a region have only 6 communities vs. 12+ we had at one point, but on a positive note, we are all close just like a family.

From corporate employees like Teri, Candi, Diane, Eastin and Jessica, to onsite team members Tammie, Kristy, Bennett, Lauren, Erin, Diane, Kim, Dustin, Lili, Alex, Dustin, Gabby, Tonya, Megan, Anne, and Cassi, everyone has been a true pleasure to work alongside.

cons: I am so satisfied about my job there are no cons

headline: My experience
pros: During the beginning of the first year being employed with Venterra, I knew nothing  really about maintenance, my first maintenance manager and his assistant took a lot of time teaching me a lot about maintenance. Including the roving manager and roving techs as well. So to them, I say thank you.
cons: My second year was pretty much difficult. Though I  learned a lot, and was sharpening my craft,  I still felt like my second direct supervisor was thw lid on my progress. It was always, good but not good enough or bad. And as far as training, if it didn't come from Regional there was no real training. Nothing to really to prepare you for a promotion or anything to move you forward. I had to create my own way to get out of the hole that I was in by applying for a different position in a different location. In the interview I realized that it could be  a strong possibility that I was heading to the same situation that I was trying to leave but just in a different location. So after the interview and putting some great thought to my decision,  I decided to leave. So in all this, I will say that I was not perfect by no means. But what I can say is the environment that was made for me was  not great as well.

I also feel like people listen to feedback we give. I know not all companies are like that so I'm glad mine is!

headline: Great Atmosphere!
pros: Venterra creates such a great atmosphere! I love that we can be open and honest and not be ostracized for it. They also promote further education, having fun, creativity, development suggestions and growth. They always look at promoting from within before hiring new staff.  The benefits are great too. Vacation time is the best I've seen offered. Where else can you get your Birthday and a day off to volunteer?
cons: It's a little more difficult to get hired on, but it's well worth the process.

headline: Corporate Good, Local Not So Good
pros: As other reviewers have noted, Venterra and the majority of its properties seem to be great places to work. Unfortunately I can't attest to this. Everyone else seems to have fun and love their jobs. There seems to be great communication and camaraderie.
cons:
Corporate and other properties seem great, but I happen to work at a property that is not so great. I was hired before the management of the local complex in Dallas came on board so I was not able to meet and evaluate if the management style would be a fit for me, as well as I for them. It turns out it's not. Management is extremely antisocial, but does turn on the social smile for upper management or important people when they come into the office. Intimidation tactics with the staff, especially maintenance staff, are used and lacks a general friendly atmosphere. Mistakes are a big no-no. If you make a mistake, like I have being new to the industry, there are no conversations with me to correct me, instead corporate meetings with regionals are call (as if it's a repeat offense) and instead of "coaching" there is blame and reprimand. 

Overall, the morale is low, to the point where every other person who was working at the Dallas property resigned because of leadership and management style.

headline: Consultant
pros: Coworkers are great, hours are decent, fun environment, a lot of bonuses, they care about they're employees', they offer constant training and employee discount. Love venterra!
cons: You work on Sundays (rotate). Base salary could be higher.

headline: A "Good" Place to work
pros: Great company with great Core Values.  Plenty of employee events and employee culture. Everyone has a desire to do their job well and take pride in what they do.
cons: As with anywhere, the company's values and culture is dependent on the leader you have. I came to this company because I heard all the great things this company does for the employees. I have seen and witnessed great things done for employees and residents. Unfortunately in my case, my manager is not quite up to par with the company's beliefs. The good treatment that I have received come from other managers in my department. I admire the fact that the managers that I don't directly report to go out of the way to make sure I feel valued. My employee experience would go from "good' to "great" if my manager would treat us as valued members of the team and not make us feel "small" every time an evaluation comes around.

headline: Regional Manager
pros:
I just hit my 5 year mark and I can tell you the biggest PRO of working for Venterra Realty is the people.  I work for the most amazing, talented, genuine folks in the industry.  There are no hidden agenda's or political games.  It is what it is.   The next Pro is everyone else loves working for Venterra as well.  It's so great to work with other people that love coming to work each day.  There is great energy and an unbelievable work environment.  The leaders have incredible work ethics, (never expecting more out of you than what they would give themselves) and impeccable character.   They manage people the right way.  I've worked for companies that just didn't get it and can honestly say they, we and I....get it.  This company has the "IT" of "they get it"  
Another PRO is we are growing because we are stable.  There is so much opportunity for those that want it.  If you are hungry to grow you can get on a path and move in that direction.  
Lastly, we care about the customer.  We are not just talk.  Venterra has programs in place that reward employees for going out of their way to give back to the customer.  We also have a program to give back to each other.  We have incentives in place to make sure we are treating our customers and fellow employees with the best appreciation/service/ and gratitude on the planet. It just doesn't get better than Venterra Realty.
cons: Any cons I would have are just normal industry cons...not related to Venterra.

cons: I wouldn't really say there are downsides to working for Venterra, but if I had to pick one thing, working on Sundays would be my least favorite part of the job.

headline: Better Living Consultant
pros: The work life balance was great.
cons: Your experience working for Venterra can definitely vary based upon who your manager and assistant manager are. So, while this doesn't apply to every Venterra property it does apply to my experience. I felt harassed on a daily basis by my APM. It was a horrible environment. It was so bad that everybody at the entire property avoided her yet nothing was ever done. In fact I was punished for standing up for myself and not allowing this workplace bully who repeatedly spewed microagressions towards anyone whom was different from her make my life miserable. Ultimately moving on from this job turned out to be the best thing that ever happened to me. This company hires people with no experience and promotes them because of who they know and who they like. However, they have plenty of people with experience and degrees who could proficiently perform the  job. I applied for a job in a different role while in my present role and was jokingly told by my manager that the regional didn't want a "young cute girl working around the contractors," as they may not take me seriously. Just too many issues. This is an old boys club and if you are okay with that than this is the place for you. If you are looking for a real career with upward mobility and fair compensation RUN! A lot of these reviews aren't even from current employees. They ask you to complete the Glassdoor survey as a part of the interview process. The only positive thing I can say is that the work life balance was decent and the corporate office definitely made an effort to create a fun environment.

headline: A Welcoming Family
pros:
I have been at Venterra for a short amount of time, but I have loved every minute of it. Everyone makes sure you feel welcome and never hesitates to help when it is needed. I've learned more about the industry in the past couple weeks then I would have ever imagined.

The hiring process was pretty lengthy, BUT it just made me that much more excited when I was hired. They want the best, and you have to prove that you will be that for them. The interview process is just as thorough as the way they run their company and that speaks volumes in itself.
cons: I have yet to experience on con since joining the team. I would recommend working for this company to anyone I know.

pros: I can go and on regarding the Pro's of this company. If you truly love helping people, you will flourish with Venterra. Since I joined this company 2 years ago, I've accomplished and gained so much in regards to both my professional and personal growth. I started with leasing and after about a year and a few months I was promoted to Assistant Community Manager/Better Living Manager. You will be provided with all the necessary training and tools you need in order to be successful. I've won awards, been acknowledged for going above and beyond, won incentives, I've traveled with the company, and despite my leaders not knowing, I've learned so much them. It's one thing to work with a company for a paycheck but it's another to work with a company that changes your life for the better. When you enjoy what you do, it doesn't feel like work. The core values of Venterra are everything I am and more. So again I say, if you truly love to be a positive impact on people's lives, if you truly love to help people daily, learn and grow in more ways than one, then this is the place for you. You have a voice and are heard everyday. Your mentors, IT department, and corporate office are always looking for ways to make your job easier and more effective. There's the Better Way program which is designed to collect feedback from the employees who mention ways to better our work system. The development team rolls out new enhancements by the week. You can actually win money by having the best Better Ways! The company wants you to have fun. We have a Fun social page and Fun Fridays that are dedicated to the enjoyment of the employees. We have such a great time! We have a Better Living Program dedicated to bettering our health and mental abilities. We have a Wow program centered on providing happiness to our residents in need. We have extra days off during the holidays and these extra days are considered "Family Days" :). As I mentioned before, I can go on and on as to why this company is definitely a prosperous career choice. I'm just simply looking forward to much more to come! Thank you Venterra for going above and beyond for all of us. I'm proud to be apart of such an amazing work family!
cons: I really don't have any cons.

headline: 15 Years Strong
pros: Yesterday marked 15 years I have been with Venterra Realty.  It‚Äôs been an amazing journey!  What a pleasure it has been to watch this organization grow into a world class company. Venterra is very understanding and appreciates the contribution that each of us makes, no matter the position you hold.  This is one of the reasons why Venterra has once again ranked in the top 100 Great Places To Work. Truly an amazing company to work for.
cons: Constant change for a better way is something Venterra is known for. So if you are not able to adjust to change Venterra would not be the company for you.

headline: 12 Years at Venterra
pros: Working for Venterra is exciting, challenging, and fun. I joined Venterra 12 years ago. I joined for opportunity, but I stay because we're on a mission and it's not complete yet. The Founders, John Foresi and Andrew Stewart built the company based on 7 personal values that serve as our Core Values today.  I'm very fortunate, proud, and happy to work for them and Venterra. Not many people can say that about their employer.
cons: It's no walk in the park - We work hard. We're passionate. We're opinionated. We embrace change. We have difficult discussions. We have more urgency than any company I know. If you're just looking for a job and to collect a paycheck, keep going. You need energy, passion, and compassion to work at Venterra.

headline: I LOVE This Company
pros: I have been working for Venterra Realty for a year now & I absolutely love it here. As an employee you can really feel that Venterra truly values each and every one of us. Venterra makes work a fun atmosphere with things such as Fun Fridays, where you come to work wearing sports jerseys, or other fun themed days. They also pay close attention to the office staff's personalities and what they expect out of their work place. We recently got a new Community Manager at the community I work at & they did a wonderful job picking a personality that would mesh well with everyone else in the office. We absolutely adore our new manager.
cons: I really have nothing negative to say about Venterra. With any other job I used to dread going into work, but I can honestly say I have not wanted to miss work one day in the past year. I genuinely love what I do & cannot wait to see what the future holds with Venterra.

headline: 9 years strong!
pros: Venterra is a great company to work with. I don't say "for" because we are a team and we work with each other. Management ensures every member of our Venterra team is equally important. Venterra has great benefits, great incentives and has been a pleasure to work with for the past 9 years.
cons: There isn't a downside working for Venterra

headline: So Far so Good

headline: Venterra Cares
pros:
The BIGGEST pro to me is that my co-workers care for me....
Last month I was moving, and as a single mom I was very stressed out dealing with this alone. With the power of teamwork, secret service skills and true genuine care for me...my co-workers chipped in and hired a cleaning company to come clean my old apartment I was living in! All of this was done secretly and was such a complete surprise to me and nicest act of kindness. It was the nicest thing to do for me at this moment in time, as I was seriously dreading the thought of moving all day just to turn around and clean my old place all night. It was almost as if they tapped into my heart and soul and figured out how they could make my day better (Venterra reference). I was completely shocked by their compassion, concern, care and team effort with pulling it off. I feel so lucky to work with such a great group of people and company, and without a doubt I know they truly care about me. In my opinion, feeling appreciated, respected and loved is very rare to come across in the work field and sometimes let alone in life.
cons: Would love better health care benefits and more competitive compensation.

headline: Former Assistant Community Manager
pros: I started working for Venterra in 2007 when they acquired a property in Pasadena, TX.  I responded to a job posting and within days I had an interview at their corporate office in Houston.  Shortly after I was contacted by a property manager who also interviewed me but at the actual property in which I would be working.  I was hired and began at the property the day in which Venterra took over early January 2007.  The hiring process was easy and the training was even better.  I began with the company as a Leasing Consultant and was promoted to Assistant Community Manager within a year.  Venterra is always willing to promote from within the company and usually do.  Over the course of the 9 years I worked for Venterra I received several awards and bonuses for my hard work.  They have amazing incentives for just about anything and each year find amazing ways to make them better including referring a friend to work for the company, a High Achievers bonus you have a chance of getting every quarter that gets better and better when you win consecutively, a Better Way suggestion board where all suggestions are read and responded to and if your idea is selected you receive at least a $100 bonus and a possibly a yearly grand prize, a Mentor program you can apply for that not only allows you to meet and get to know your colleagues but also offers a bonus each time you help by training someone new, and awards at the annual Kick Off for each position based on their yearly performance.  As an employee you get several paid holidays off and even your birthday is included as one of those days.  I cannot say enough good about this company, and the ways in which they helped me grow, learn, and better myself as a person and employee.  They care deeply for their employees, their residents they love to "WOW" and even giving back with charity work such as raising thousands for breast cancer awareness through the Susan G. Komen Foundation.  I even obtained my Bachelors Degree while working full time for Venterra and opted to stay with them because I loved the company and people so much.  I would recommend anyone to work for Venterra, and had my property not been sold which is part of the business, I would still be working for them today.  Being a part of the Venterra family will change your life for the better.
cons: If you are looking for a just a job, and lack passion and motivation, this will not be the company for you.  They are a company that pushes you to your full potential, is challenging and thorough because they only want the best for their prospects and residents, that puts customer service first and that will require you to work hard and do well.  After 9 years of working for them I assure you there is a reason for all they expect of you, and if and when you leave the company you will discover that working for them has molded you into an exceptional employee, and the skills and lessons learned will only benefit you.  I have always appreciated any feedback and constructive criticism given to me by my leaders, because it challenged and pushed me to do and be better, and in hindsight I know I have grown so much and I am incredibly thankful for the time I had with Venterra.

headline: Awesome Company
pros: I have been with Venterra for 9 years !  Awesome company with some of the best supervisors I have ever had the privilege to work with ! You have a voice and your opinions and ideas are heard. Innovative, cutting edge, and creative are just a few words to express them.

headline: 5 months in!

Venterra does a wonderful job at keeping the lines of communication open and consistent with its employees. I never hesitate to say that this is a company I am a part of. Proud to be a Venterra employee.

headline: Truly A Wonderful Company !
pros: A very thorough interview process with three different interviews with three different levels of management. It was a great way to learn what the job was all about from three different perspectives. As soon as I was offered the job, I was flown to Atlanta for training. The training is/was very clear and extensive which made me feel confident when I started. Everyone I've met is so kind and willing to help. There's so much of this company's culture that is for the people. You have so many opportunities to grow and learn and live better ! I love it !
cons: If you're not a fan of travelling, prizes, and great management than I guess that would be a downside. If you don't like being rewarded for doing a good job or for completing your goals, then this isn't the place for you. BUT if you are, I definitely recommend Venterra !

headline: Venterra Realty
pros:
1) Venterra is extremely organized (if done correctly by all staff members) in their make ready process such as the agent walk, then the TQMR process. They want to make sure every single detail of the apartment is ready for the resident at move in.

2) The WOW program for residents was awesome!

3) Employee portal was fun and kept you up to date, I loved being able to submit 'Better Ways', posting WOW stories, being able to look up employees and birthdays, etc etc.. 

4) Annual Kick-off and award ceremonies

5) They were always doing fun contests for the employees and genuinely made work fun (so long as the manager was making it fun)

Venterra's expectations are extremely high and it made me want to work hard and accomplish the goals I had for myself. Met a lot of great people and had a blast at company events.
cons:
During my time at Venterra it became very apparent that my RM was very, no.. EXTREMELY pro-manager. Even when she noticed things weren't being done the correct way. Venterra always encouraged us to talk to our leaders if we felt like something wasn't being done correctly, and when I brought things to my CM and my RM, they would brush it off and the RM would take the managers side. Because of doing this, I felt like things quickly went downhill for me. They made it seem like I was a problem child or something. I noticed them acting differently towards me, and quickly noticed that my hard work and promotions I felt I deserved were quickly overlooked. As with any company, politics and extreme favoritism became very visible. 

Another reason I decided to leave Venterra was the low pay. I did research and quickly found that the compensation I was receiving for my position was very low compared to others, not only that, but be careful because if you make ONE tiny mistake or human error, you will soon hear about it on your review and it will cost you a raise even if you did a million other things right. Don't get me wrong, you do need to earn a raise, but some of the things on evaluations were kind of absurd.

headline: Excellent Place to Build a Career
pros:
I have been with the company for several years now and have received numerous promotions and raises based on accomplishments. I have had the opportunity to work with bright, hard working peers and enjoy great support from regional and executive teams.
I have recently passed on higher offers because of this company's culture and dedication to work life balance. Of course there are companies that will offer a higher salary to recruit good talent, but at what cost? I feel like the pay I receive is fair. I left my previous employer to take a job with Venterra making 1/3 of what I was accustomed to and I have not looked back.
cons: I will echo other reviews I have seen - if you don't like to work hard and break new ground this is not the company for you. That said, we sure do play hard too!

headline: Better Living Manager
pros: Venterra Realty is a dynamic organization that values its employees and allows for professional growth by promoting from within. The recruiting team and managers are professional, attentive, and are truly responsive in helping every team member reach their career goals.
cons: The salary and benefit package could be more competitive.

headline: Great culture, positive work environment, honest and successful business.
pros: Entrepreneurial spirit at the corporate office offers a lot of flexibility how work gets done. Lots of challenges and opportunities for learning as the business continues to grow. Relatively young and lively management team. Strong sense of family with frequent employee bonding activities.
cons: Financial incentives and benefits just seem average.

headline: Yey team!
pros: I thoroughly enjoy working for Venterra Realty. I am so proud to have such a great company to call my employer. Company culture has always been important to me and Venterra's culture is one that honestly cares not only about their product and customer but of the team that represents it!
cons: I have to work some Sunday hours. But not every week!

headline: Salaries need attention
pros: Venterra is a great company and the culture is awesome! There is a team environment feel and they keep it fun!
cons: Salaries- do not match their employees accomplishments/experiences, and is more based off unit count of the community.

headline: A Culture Unlike Anything Else
pros:
While most companies have a network of people just doing their job Venterra Realty is a culture filled with people doing something they enjoy.

The career opportunities are vast with great chances of internal promotion .

The training you receive is invaluable and detailed.

No matter what property you work at you encounter a culture of friendly people willing to help and add to your knowledge.

The computer programs and apps that the company uses make life so much easier and efficient.

Rather than scold; leadership presents their suggestions in a way that communicated that they are there to help you and make you better.
cons: If you're the kind of person who doesn't like extra events or "fun days" with your company than that could be a con, but if you are into participating and having a good time then you are good to go!

headline: Venterra
pros: I am overall impressed by this company.
cons: I do not have any cons at this time

headline: Asst. Community manager
pros: They are all about taking care of their residents and their employees. They go above and beyond for all of us. I love the vacation time and sick time we get, as well as birthdays are a paid off day! What other company would appreciate them to give them their birthday off automatically and make it a paid day!
cons: Pay rate is a little lower than what I think is fare. Also whenever you have questions and you go to senior management instead of sometimes owning up that they don't know the answer but they will find out for you they just make something up. Senior management will never admit when they drop the ball.

headline: Great Company with Long-term Growth Opportunities
pros: Venterra offers its employees the chance to grow and be promoted within. Venterra always offers new positional opportunities internally to its current employees prior to promoting externally. And most of the time these positions are filled from within. I've been with Venterra for many years and have continued to grow.
cons: While Venterra continues to look for the best benefits and plans for its employees it would be nice to have more health benefits available (i.e. gym memberships, higher vision plans, etc). Our insurance does offer gym discounts, however, most of the gyms listed on the site are not well known or close to where I live.

headline: Venterra workplace
pros: Friendly people. Decent commission. It's an easy and fun job, where you get to meet new and interesting people. You also get a small discount for working for the company, if you live on one of their properties.
cons: Venterra gives higher appreciation and preference to those employees who have been with the company the longest.  Part-time employees taken advantage of, and work almost full-time but not enough to be paid benefits. If you're a new employee, you better not have a social life, because your weekends are getting spent in the office. Your commission gets paid on the 15th of the month, after residents move in.

headline: Ready for a great career?
pros: Venterra is a well ran, and well organized corporation. Who strives on excellence in everything we do. I enjoy the fact that we have a 30 Day Live It Love It Guarantee, as well as pride ourselves in customer service at No Risk by WoW-ing the residents every day! There is definitely a sense of home for not only the residents, but the employees. The fact that the CEO & COO's care so much on what the onsite staff are saying is very unique as well. You are held to a high standard, and are always pushed for the next step. I truly feel that there is no other corporation that would be like this one - not a job, but a career
cons: I can not think of anything.

headline: Positive Work Place
pros: Awesome training great group of people to work for.
cons: The Ellis Shops are very stressful.

headline: Awesome Opportunity
pros: The best reasons to work at Venterra Realty are great hours, opportunities, great working environment.
cons: The downsides of working at Venterra Realty are when asked to come up with personal goals at the work place when you're trying to fulfill the goals for the company. Sometimes there is not enough time.

headline: Career building organization with great core values that extend to its employees.
pros: You truly have a voice.  "Better Way of Living" is not just a brand, it's a promise to both its residents and employees.  Strong core values exhibited starting at the top, leading by example.
cons: I dont know if this is a con or not, but Venterra has extremely high expectations. Venterra is a career choice, not just a job.  These expectations seperate the A players from the rest.   However, Venterra offers excellent support to help achieve your goals, with a grand payoff.  Success is definitely celebrated.

headline: Venterra is by far the very best management company in the industry.
pros: Venterra is one of very few companies dedicated to the success of its employees. Through their never ending pursuit of excellence and team first attitude, Venterra has become the very definition of setting the example for all businesses. I have grown to be a better employee and a better person working for Venterra and I am forever grateful for all they have taught me through the years. I have been promoted twice with the company and witnessed dozens of other promotions.
cons: There aren't any cons to working for Venterra. If there ever are, they are the kind of company who listens and makes changes that benefit the employees.

headline: My initial new hire experience has been very pleasant.  It has been a great experience so far working for Venterra.
pros: Venterra is a great company to work for.  They have a great benefits package and time off policy.  They treat their employees very well and believe on promoting from within.
cons: I have no complaints about Venterra so far.  The hiring and training process went smoothly and I work with a great team!

headline: Venterra genuinely cares about their employees and that is one thing I noticed right away working for them!
pros: I love working for Venterra because of all of the programs they do to keep everyone involved, like WOWs & Better Living, etc. They have annual events that bring all of the employees together and they also have programs that are there for their customers to receive the best customer service! My Managers are always very easy to come to with questions or concerns, I always feel like I have someone to go to if needed! Venterra is also very big on promoting within, so they give you endless open opportunities to work up to!
cons: I do think as far as office hours go on the weekends that it's a little excessive. I feel like Sundays are family days and that the offices should be closed. Especially considering the office hours during the week days are fully accessible as we are open late two nights a week and are here 7 hours on Saturdays.

headline: Great company
pros: Very fun place to work!
cons: Better pay for workers would be good

headline: I am very fortunate to work for Venterra Realty!
pros: I am very fortunate to be a part of the Venterra team for many reasons.  The new employee training was very informative, exciting, and kept me wanting to know more about the company and my job.  The benefits and schedule flexibility are wonderful for me even as a part-time employee. I work in a positive work environment where there is great communication with management and your hard work and achievements are recognized!
cons: There is a long interview process but that is what showed me what a great company this is.  I am glad the process is lengthy because I believe that is what assists in building a positive work environment where everyone grows as a team.

headline: Great customer centric values and fun work environment.
pros:
- They provide great training for new employees. 
- Fun work environment. 
- Manager is easy to communicate with and shows care in the employees. 
- You get to wear many different hats as a leasing agent so there is always something to do besides working with prospects. 
- Promotions from within.
- Big emphasis on great customer service and brand value.
- Great benefits for full time employees
cons:
- You may be required to commute to different properties to fill in the office duties. Some of those commute drives can take up to an hour.
- Those who used to work till 5pm might not like the fact that some properties stay open till 7pm on week days. 
- Since the business is all about dealing with people, you will occasionally be working with some mildly to very unpleasant prospects and residents so you have to be able to quickly regain attitude and shake off negativity.

headline: New Employee Experience
pros: The office culture and dynamics are exactly what I was looking for in my job search. There is a strong sense of community and support of one another, which is a very rare find. One of the biggest pros I've noted thus far is how much Venterra promotes and encourages a positive work environment. It is very apparent through different outlets and programs such as the WOW nominations, where you can post a story about an employee that did something that wowed you. Those stories can be voted on throughout the year and can sometimes produce a monetary reward for that employee at the end of the year. Recognizing the employees is the best way to keep them happy!
cons:
A couple of the negatives for me at this point are that the location of the corporate office is a bit remote and far from everything. The neighborhood is also a little scary at night.
Secondly, the balance between the salary and the work volume for my particular role is a bit skewed. There is a demand for a high volume of work but the compensation does not match the work.

headline: Fantastic
pros: Company is very focused on happy employees and engages us in many ways. We're strongly encouraged to use our voices to encourage positive change. There is also a lot of focus on fun with quarterly meetings and better living contests. Senior management and executive level is very approachable and seems genuinely interested in employee success and achievements.
cons: Not necessarily a con, but if you're going to be successful with Venterra, you have to be willing to work a little harder than you probably would with most companies. Work/Life balance can be challenging at times. Our employee's A-Player mentality is what makes us so successful and without that, you will not enjoy the company.

headline: Wonderful Company
pros: There are many things I love about Venterra but a lot has to do with their values and the amazing people working for the company. They have many initiatives including the better way initiative. This is where anyone can share their ideas for improvement. This company truly values our thoughts and ideas and it is refreshing! One of their core values is to be open and candid with each other. I think that is something that helps a company thrive and promotes communication between all team members and upper management. I don't think I have ever worked for another company who encouraged these things! In addition, Venterra employs people who have values in themselves that match the companies core values. This means that I have also been blessed to work with some amazing people who are smart, talented, giving and encouraging. Venterra also thrives to promote from within, so they continue to promote people who may have started at the bottom but show they love their job and continue to grow.
cons: While some of us may get paid less than what other companies would pay, the culture is worth it. Venterra provides many initiatives and gives us such a great atmosphere that you almost don't care what you get paid.

headline: Great Life-Changing Experience and such an AWESOME company!
pros: Venterra Realty believes in YOU and will help you grow in more ways than one. Amazing staff.
cons: No cons available for Venterra Realty. I enjoyed everyone which of whom I interviewed with.

headline: I loved the company and their values.
pros: Corporate Values and attention to detail was surpassed any mgmt. company
cons: Somerset is a sister property (AND nicer) across the street.  During my 3 years of employment, I ran the property alone  be mgmt. was always at Somerset gossiping

headline: Great Company to work for!
pros: I have been with Venterra for over a year and it is by the far the best company I have ever worked for. You are valued and appreciated for your hard work. You are asked to express your opinions and they are heard. Venterra has great opportunities for growth in the company as well as providing tools to improve your life outside of work like the Better Living Initiative. Very positive experience for employees and for residents that live at a Venterra community.
cons: I personally do not have any cons.

headline: Happy Employee for 5 years
pros: Venterra is a great company that promotes from within. They really are focused on how hard you work, and strive to promote from within. They have a great training program to help prepare you for the next step.
cons: The benefits are great with Venterra. We are open more than any other Property Management Company out there for our customers. Most offices are open 9-7.

headline: Venterra is a great company with great opportunities!
pros: Venterra has core values that are unlike any other company. They are extremely customer service focused, in tune with their employees and set themselves to a standard above the rest. The Venterra culture is unmatched and a wonderful culture to be a part of.  Venterra wants you to succeed, recognizes hard work and has a great track record of promoting from within.
cons: As a Venterra employee, you are held to high standards as a representative of the high standards the company holds itself to. That means not everyone is the right fit for Venterra. In order to succeed, you may need to take extra steps to make sure the job is done right.

headline: Great company that wants to make everyone's life better!
pros: I am very fortunate to be with a company that understands how to invest in its people.  There are so many opportunities to learn and excel not just professionally but personally as well.  The people I work with are very friendly and team oriented.  I was accepted as part of the team from day 1!  Venterra really wants us to take care of our residents and it makes it so much easier and natural when you are a happy camper:)
cons: So far, I don't have any cons to speak of

headline: Fun and great learning experience.
pros: Working in the office keeps you busy and your days go by fast. The employees are very down to earth and fun to work with. Managers want to see you do well and are always available to talk with. Compensation and benefits are pretty decent.  Many residents and prospects love our company because we are simply the best when it comes to customer service. I never dread coming to work, everyday is different and it keeps work interesting.
cons: Working Sundays is something I personally do not like at all. It can be hard to balance your work life and personal life when those times are on Sundays.

headline: My Favorite Company So Far
pros: I have been with Venterra for almost 2 years and have loved working for the company. I was new to property management when I started and fell in love with it. I love that we have an opportunity to WOW our residents. Each month, we have an allotted amount of money to do something special for a resident or residents that we see fit that particular month, whether it's someone who had an unfortunate situation come up or that we just wanted to surprise. That has been my favorite part of working for Venterra so far. I feel like an individual that the company cares about, and not just a number, as so many employers look at their employees. I base my life around integrity and would not be able to work for a company who didn't represent strong values and exemplify integrity in their policies. I think we have more than enough opportunities to extend our education and learn from others in the company. Richard, our COO is awesome and actually visits the communities enough so that employees actually get to know him. I think the long interview process shows that they really care about who they hire and about finding the right long term employees. Compensation is fair, although I do wish our raises were higher, but who doesn't want that? Overall, my experience has been very positive and I plan on staying with the company for a long time!
cons: I work in one of the Nashville locations and I do wish there were more properties out here and room to grow with the company in Nashville.

headline: Breath of fresh air
pros: This is a company that seems to truly care about employee well-being. They have many programs to encourage , being an "active employee". Their customer service focus is great! As a leasing consultant we are the front line of the company so it is nice to know we have the ability to "make things right". They openly ask for your opinion AND give you the feeling that they are actually listening. I love my job and know that with hard work and an open mind I have opportunities to grow with this company!  They have a lot of programs that give you opportunists to win/earn money, benefit package is excellent, as well as a discount on rent for any Venterra owned property.
cons: Not many that I have ran into yet. Be prepared to work weekends all the time if you are a leasing consultant. Not a huge issue for myself just an FYI. But even the weekend shifts allow time to actually have a life.

headline: Venterra is the type of company that makes you a better person while allowing you to earn a paycheck.
pros: I have been with Venterra for a short period of time; and its been long enough to know, that this is the type of company one would want to retire with. It pushes you out of your comfort zone and provides you with the right tools for success. Wide opportunity for growth and personal satisfaction. It allows you to expand your career while encouraging you to reach your personal goals. Everything Venterra stands for is unique and once you work for them you wont settle for less.
cons: The benefit package could include a lot more.

headline: A place of work where my talents are utilized and I feel appreciated everyday I come to work.
pros: This company really makes you feel valued and appreciated which is something I've never experienced on the job before. Everyone I've met so far in management is friendly, helpful, positive, and motivational. They really invest in their employees and set them up for success. Even when you make mistakes they are corrected in a positive and upbeat manner. This company also has several initiatives to better the employees lives. For example the better living campaign: Where you post your goals (work related or not, mostly not) and fellow colleagues and management can post words of encouragement and really join in on the process. I find this so conducive to the positive attitude I bring to work. It's nice to know the company I work for is really interested in my happiness. What more could you ask for?
cons: The only Con I have experienced since joining this company in July is the often rude, entitled and disgruntled TENANTS at the property I work at. I often find myself completely drained trying to help someone who is refusing to be helped. I'm learning not to take it so personally. This is not really a Venterra issue, more of a site specific issue for those of us on property. Also the starting pay is a little low, however I do appreciate that you are eligible for a raise every 3 months. <3

headline: Very grateful to be apart of this company!
pros: Venterra is probably one of the best companies to work for, everyone I work with is always really helpful! From now and when I first started, I never feel that no one is here to answer my questions. It's so refreshing being apart of a company of whom cares so much about their employees and strives to help one another succeed and promote within the company! Venterra also has core values that they stand strongly by. A couple of my favorite core values are Honest and Integrity and the Never-Ending pursuit of Excellence.
cons: If you are not experienced with customer service, then you should probably consider taking a different route. You deal with people day to day and work to meet their needs!

headline: The BEST company I have worked for!
pros: I love working for Venterra as they make you feel as part of a company and not just as someone who works for them.  They hear your voice and make things happen.  They also give you the tools you need to become successful.  I love that they believe in you and promote from within.  I have had several promotions in my 7 years with the company.
cons: I hear around that some companies pay you vacation time if you want to cash it out and Venterra does not.  They do encourage time off though to regroup.

headline: The four years that I have been with Venterra have been great!
pros: Venterra is a very caring company whether it's their employees or residents. I have heard horror stories about other property management companies and I'm so glad I haven't had to experience that. I can say that one of my favorite things we have right now is something called Better Living. It gives employees the opportunity to be encouraged by others about their goals and dreams. It also holds you accountable too :)
cons: I would say the only con is selling properties. But that happens with every property management company. Once one is sold, we get another one. That's just how the business goes.

headline: Venterra is unlike any other MFI company out there, one who's culture is truly focused on improvement and growth.
pros: The corporate culture is one that encourages employees to develop both professionally and personally.  There is a huge focus on resident satisfaction and Venterra always does the 'right' thing.  In the Multi-Family Industry, there are companies who talk a good game, but Venterra can back it up.  It is refreshing to be able to sleep soundly at night because everyday is spent doing everything I can for my residents and team members to make this the best place to live and the best place to work!
cons: The only Con is that there aren't more Venterra communities across the country.  It's a shame to not offer this living and working experience in more markets.

headline: This company and its managers were one of the greatest periods of my life!
pros:
You are heard by supervisor (s).  You are respected. Your opinions and ideas are valued.  If Venterra was a characteristic, it would be"down to earth" because of the comfort and openness it strives on in tge workplace. You are taught, not just "trained".  Every moment is a teaching moment with them.  Examples of pros are:
As an employee, you will complete Surveys on your managers and they will be deeply analyzed. 
Bonus metrics that make sense with CS
Ranked properties and competitive scores
Entire company kept updated via email, including direct emails of acquisitions from the President. 
Newsletter celebrating bdays & anniversaries each week 
Everyone so gracious and family like
Days off - Holiday hours
Flowers sent to me from my supervisor. 
Mentor and question-asking outlets JAM!
cons: Budgets. As a manager, it was difficult to attend to budgets on a money-draining asset.

headline: Best company to work with.
pros: Venterra holds high standards and we also hold the same standards. This does not work for everybody. The ones that can work and maintain the high standards love it. Core values , training , compensation and my Venterra Family make it worth it.
cons: I have no cons for Venterra. I was aware of the standards when I took the job.

headline: Venterra is the Best Career decision I have ever made, 7 years and looking forward to many more to come...
pros: I was hired as a Maintenance Manager in 2007 and Venterra recognized my hard work and dedication and promoted me to Regional Maintenance Manager in 2010.  Venterra is A company that recognizes your efforts and builds on them.  A company that is built on a foundation of Core Values that are non-negotiable.  Venterra works very hard to drive employee satisfaction and creating a Culture/Environment were people enjoy coming to work.
cons: It is hard to come up with "Cons" in speaking about Venterra.  Venterra is a company that has very high standards and that may be difficult for some to adapt to.

headline: Great company with a unique approach
pros: The best thing I can say about Venterra is that the company cares about it's people and is intent on hiring those that fit with the culture of the company.  The company is in a constant state of improvement and involves every employee in the process.  The focus is on the quality of the product and the quality of the service.  Customer satisfaction is HUGE.  The good thing is, "customer" does not just refer to clients and potential clients, "customer" also refers to the employees.  Employees that perform are recognized and rewarded.  There is definitely a TEAM atmosphere that pervades throughout Venterra.
cons: The company is definitely not for everyone.  If you are not willing to take ownership of your responsibilities, constantly improve yourself, and search for a better way of doing your job, you might as well look elsewhere.  Though I don't consider it a negative, the search for constant improvement and positive change can be challenging.

headline: happy to come to work every day
pros: Venterra has a lot to offer great benefits and fun things to strive for like wows better living and better way. You can grow within company and need I say more about the team I work with they are the best ever.
cons: like with every multifamily company I have worked for is not enough time in the day to complete task at hand. Would like to see some training that would give maintenance some certifications.

headline: Wow, Such a great Company to enjoy a career.
pros: Since I started working for Venterra over 7 years ago, I have repeatedly been promoted, due to hard work and efforts, an now fill a Corporate Level position. Venterra truly understands ones passions and desires and rewards those efforts.
cons: I have nothing negative to speak of. Benefits are great, compensation is very strong, the training programs are amazing and room for growth is plentiful.

headline: Awesome company to work for, I can only describe it as one big family.
pros: Good training, Venterra will train and polish their employees to become the best version of them selves. Good Pay and the company really values what employees think. Venterra has a unique way to keep everyone engaged at work. This is a company that promotes within and all hard work is recognize. Richard Roos is the only (COO) I've worked for that takes the time to talk to all employees and see how there doing while touring any of our properties.
cons: Not much for cons. I would be nice to be able to cash vacation time, once 80 hours of vacation are accrued you have to either take time off in a busy time of the year or continue to work without accruing vacation time.

headline: One of my best career moves!
pros: I enjoy coming to work every day. I love my team and the energy level in our office.  Venterra's core values and expectations have raised my personal level of customer service expectations.  We are expected to deliver the best customer service and always enhance the customer experience, and as employers, Venterra does the same for us.  Venterra promotes a healthy family-work life, and has incentives for people who promote a better way of living.  Vacation, personal days, paid holidays, award ceremonies, bonuses and personal recognition from upper management for a job well done are a part of the Venterra culture.
cons: Compensation does not seem to be as high as other opportunities in the industry, but reasonable and with the other perks, well worth it.

headline: Customer service inside and out
pros: It is truly a rare instance when a company practices what they preach.  Venterra is one of those companies.  The Multi-Family Real Estate world is full of providers that market customer service as a cornerstone to apartment living, but there are only a few that actually place a strong focus on the effort in terms of programs and awards/support.  The key is to support the effort from the top to the bottom.  Venterra's leaders place a strong focus on providing exceptional customer service to the team members who, in turn, provide the same experience for our residents.  Internal programs are highlighted with awards/prizes and include the Better Way - which offers the opportunity to identify areas for improvement and Better Living - which provides a forum for team members to create personal goals and cheer each other on to achieving personal milestones.  These programs and the backing of senior leadership create a fun and very positive working environment.
cons: Expectations are very high and demands placed on team members are equally challenging.  While the company places a high value on work/life balance, those that do not place high emphasis on time management and personal organization will struggle to take advantage of the work/life opportunities.  Be prepared to get to work!

headline: Great customer service...mediocre employee pay compared to work expectations.
pros: When you get leases, the commission is great! When it's slow...pay is mediocre to say the least.
cons:
Because you can't punch in or out, there is no reliable way to track your time worked. They have you fill out time sheets, but they expect you to open your office at least 15 minutes early and stay at least 15 late on most days without getting paid for that time. You are only allowed to write in 8 hours instead of 8.5. 30 minutes daily adds up to quite a bit over time. 

They will sometimes have you go to other properties to "help out" and promise you that they will give you the overtime... but Venterra won't pay the overtime...they will simply put it as straight time on your check. Tell me...how does working up to 110 hours in 2 weeks not justify overtime pay?

As an employee, if you want to live on-site, you only get a 20% discount. But, if you work for the property 30 min-1 hour a week as a "Cares Team" employee and wrap some plungers you get 50-75% off your rent. Doesn't make much sense...

headline: Love this company!
pros: They offer very attainable bonus structures, good pay, and outstanding company values.
cons: They are very concerned about customer service, not realizing that the staff has a family life too. The weekends and late evenings does not allow us to spend as much time with our family as we would like.

headline: 7 Years Strong
pros: I've been with Venterra for 7 years and it's been a really great ride so far.  One of my favorite aspects about Venterra is that they strive to promote from within.  As such, I have been able to work my way up through many positions.  I am so fortunate to have such a great boss and team to work with at Venterra. It really is like a family.
cons: Venterra is a challenging company, so if you like a good challenge and like to push yourself to the limits, then Venterra is definitely for you. If you're looking for mediocre, Venterra may not be the best fit for you.

headline: Venterra is an amazing company that cares about the staff and creates initiatives to show they appreciate you.
pros: I feel appreciated when I do a good job. Sr management invests in me to help me grow as a person and employee. Staff meetings with Sr managements are weekly which are a great time to get one on one time with them.
cons: VERY VERY large work load. The work load and what is expected of staff is much larger than at other companies.

headline: One of the most unique.
pros: It's my second family, I enjoy going to work and being appreciated, I absolutely love it, they promote within and recognize everyone. There is an answer for everything and the help they give you when your stuck as far as support, words can not explain how great they are.
cons:
Vacation, if we could get a check for vacation and still work, that would be great. 
Regionals/Managers, 90% of the time take sides with residents or prospects even though the resident/prospect are untruthful or wrong.

headline: Overall pleasing, but lack of communication between Regionals and Property Staff with exception of Prop Manager.
pros: The Core Values are unmatched in the industry. Change can be a good thing! The wonderful people who built this company are brilliant. I believe Venterra has a promising future. I am deeply saddened and wish I could have stayed to be part of it. After living in a Venterra Community, you will not be happy anywhere else.
cons: When an employee has a skill set for higher level position, most voices go unheard. Mostly true when the regional and onsite manager are friends outside of work. Occasionally,  a manager has become complacent in their role, and nothing is done to mediate this, causing unhappy residents and poor online reviews, which could easily be avoided. headline: Be wary of recruiters upselling the role
pros:
- Some very intelligent people with strong work ethics
- Smart business model run by smart executives ensures company will probably be around for a long time delivering good returns for investors (not that employees are able to participate in the returns in any way, shape or form)
- Opportunity to learn about the real estate investment world (and also how the rich are able to keep getting richer)
- Depending on role, pay can be higher than average 
- Senior leadership tries to put the effort to promote inclusive environment (i.e. social committee, events in cafeteria, etc)
cons:
- Please note this is specific to the Richmond Hill Office (where backoffice roles are). 
- Workload can become unmanageable. From the ground level it seems like there is no way to win. You get reprimanded if your work output is deemed insufficient. You then get reprimanded if you try to put in extra hours to increase your work output (because it supposedly reflects poorly on manager if one of their resources seems to consistently be staying late)
- Despite what recruiters may pitch you, the turnover rate is much higher than what they represent (they will tell you turnover is low and that internal promotions happen all the time) - people would be laid off or disappear overnight at times with no broader communication. 
- Management pats itself on the back with skewed employee survey statistics. They are skewed because:
    a) It's generally understood that management will try to pinpoint who gave unfavourable ratings (it's a fairly small office with small teams, so not difficult).  Management will indeed huddle and scrutinize results - from the ground level it seems certain managers attempt to pinpoint which individuals gave low ratings and justify why those ratings should be written off as outliers instead of actually trying to address the root cause of why the rating was so low. During my debrief meeting, manager was actually namedropping who they thought was responsible for the outlier response and grilling them on the spot to justify the rating. Overall there's definitely a sense that employees will receive retribution for giving low ratings
     b) Due to fairly high turnover rate, a good percentage of survey respondents are new recruits who are settling in. 
- Quality of managers greatly varies from one team to the next
